page.title: 09Entertainment - Music.
page.content: There is a strong tradition of music in our area, in particular brass bands. They date from around 1800, but the oldest is Holme Brass Band. It was originally led by Fenton Renshaw and gained several first prizes. There was much rivalry between the local bands and it was quite common for each to hold a contest of its own. Holme Brass Band is presently known as Holme Silver Band which meets on Wednesdays and Sundays just outside the village of Holme. The Band Room has been extended and caters for visiting local bands. Today many local people are associated with the band and children in local primary and secondary schools are encouraged to take up musical instruments, continuing the local tradition. Musical interest in schools led to formation of Holme Valley Choir
